content:
Based on the iFlow analysis, the "woo103" iFlow expects an XML payload via HTTP POST to create products. Each product should have a name, category (bathroom), and other typical product fields.

Here is a sample XML payload to create 2 bathroom products:

```xml
<Products>
    <Product>
        <Name>Elegant Bathroom Sink</Name>
        <Category>Bathroom</Category>
        <SKU>BSINK001</SKU>
        <Price>120.00</Price>
        <Description>Ceramic sink with modern design</Description>
    </Product>
    <Product>
        <Name>Luxury Shower Head</Name>
        <Category>Bathroom</Category>
        <SKU>SHOWER002</SKU>
        <Price>85.50</Price>
        <Description>High-pressure shower head with chrome finish</Description>
    </Product>
</Products>
```

The names of the products are:
- Elegant Bathroom Sink
- Luxury Shower Head

Would you like me to proceed with testing the iFlow using this payload and provide the response? If yes, please confirm or provide the endpoint path for the iFlow, or let me fetch it for you.
